com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api

Interface OutputRecord

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Record

    public interface OutputRecord
extends Record
    Interface for manipulating an outgoing stream record. If Java bean object is specified by Processor.getBeanForOutput(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Link) for this link, user code can set the Java bean object as record. The following example shows how to set the bean object to the outgoing record. 

        MyOutputBean outputObject = new MyOutputBean();
    outputObject.setName(inputObject.getName().toUpperCase());
    // create a new output object
    OutputRecord outputRecord = _outputLink.getOutputRecord();
    outputRecord.putObject(outputObject);
    _outputLink.writeRecord(outputRecord);

    In addition, user code can set the column data by specifying the column name or index. The followng example shows how to set the column data in the outgoing record. 

        OutputRecord outputRecord = _outputLink.getOutputRecord();
    outputRecord.setValue("name", inputObject.getName().toUpperCase());
    _outputLink.writeRecord(outputRecord);

    Version:
    1.0

    • Method Detail

      • putObject

        void putObject(Object bean)
               throws IllegalAccessException,
                      InvocationTargetException
        Sets a Java bean object of type specified by Processor.getBeanForOutput(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Link)
        Parameters:
        bean - A JavaBean object
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if JavaBean class is not specified to the link.
        IllegalArgumentException - if bean is null.
        IllegalAccessException - If the caller does not have access to the property getter method.
        InvocationTargetException - If the property getter method throws an exception.

      • setValue

        void setValue(String columnName,
            Object value)
        Sets the value of a column corresponding to a given column name.

        The value object must be of type specified by ColumnMetadata.getType(). If type is mismatched, ClassCastException will be thrown when writing this record by calling OutputLink.writeRecord(OutputRecord). The null indicator will be set to the nullable column if value is null.

        Parameters:
        columnName - column name (case insensitive)
        value - The value to set
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If any of the following is true:
        • columnName is null
        • Given name of column is not found on this link
        • Numeric value is out-of-range
        • value is null but output column is non-nullable

      • setValue

        void setValue(int columnIndex,
            Object value)
        Sets the value of a column corresponding to a given position in this record.

        The value object must be of type specified by ColumnMetadata.getType(). If type is mismatched, ClassCastException will be thrown when writing this record by calling OutputLink.writeRecord(OutputRecord). The null indicator will be set to the nullable column if value is null.

        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The position of column in this record.
        value - The value to set
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the columnIndex is invalid.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the numeric value is out-of-range, or null is set to the non-nullable field.

      • setValueAsString

        void setValueAsString(String columnName,
                    String value)
        Convenience method for setting the value of a column corresponding to a given name in this record as a String.

        This will construct a object of type specified by ColumnMetadata.getType() that represents the value indicated by the String parameter. The null indicator will be set to the nullable column if value is null.

        Bit, TinyInt, SmallInt, Integer conversion is based on the rule of strtoll() of C Standard Library. After the conversion to long, range is checked and construct a object using valueOf() method of each numeric class. If converted value is out-of-range, IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.

        BigInt conversion is performed using BigInteger.BigInteger(String) with given String value. After conversion to BigInteger, range is checcked. If converted value is out-of-range, IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.

        Float, Real, Double conversion is based on the rule of strtod() of C Standard Library. After the conversion to double, range is checked and construct a object using valueOf() method of each numeric class. If converted value is out-of-range, IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.

        Numeric and Double conversion is performed using BigDecimal.BigDecimal(String) with given String value. MathContext.MathContext(int, RoundingMode) is used for setting presion of BigDecimal based on output column precision. Scale is checked for constructed BigDecimal, and if scale does not match the value defined in output column, it is overwritten with the scale defined in output column. If constructed BigDecimal is out-of-range, IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.

        Binary, VarBinary and LongVarBinary conversion is performed using String.getBytes() with given String value.

        Date conversion is performed using Date.valueOf(String) with given String value. If given String does not match the format of "yyyy-mm-dd", IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        Values from "1582-10-05" to "1582-10-14" are converted by adding 10 days because of the difference between Julian and Gregorian calendar systems. See GregorianCalendar reference for details.

        Time conversion is performed using TimeMicroseconds.valueOf(String) with given String value. If given String does not match the format of "hh:mm:ss[.f...]" (The fractional seconds may be omitted), IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.

        Timestamp conversion is performed by parsing given String value. If given String does not match the format of "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss[.ffffff]" (The fractional seconds may be omitted), IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        Delimiter can be any ascii character, except for the period before fractional seconds value.
        Values from "1582-10-05" to "1582-10-14" are converted by adding 10 days because of the difference between Julian and Gregorian calendar systems. See GregorianCalendar reference for details.

        No conversion is performed for Char, VarChar, LongVarChar, NChar, NVarChar, LongNVarChar and Unknown types.

        Parameters:
        columnName - column name (case insensitive)
        value - The value as a string to set
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If any of the following is true:
        • columnName is null
        • Given name of column is not found on this link
        • value is invalid
        • value is out-of-range
        • value is null but output column is non-nullable

      • setValueAsString

        void setValueAsString(int columnIndex,
                    String value)
        Convenience method for setting the value of a column corresponding to a given position in this record as a String.

        This will construct a object of type specified by ColumnMetadata.getType() that represents the value indicated by the String parameter. The null indicator will be set to the nullable column if value is null.

        Bit, TinyInt, SmallInt, Integer conversion is based on the rule of strtoll() of C Standard Library. After the conversion to long, range is checked and construct a object using valueOf() method of each numeric class. If converted value is out-of-range, IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.

        BigInt conversion is performed using BigInteger.BigInteger(String) with given String value. After conversion to BigInteger, range is checcked. If converted value is out-of-range, IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.

        Float, Real, Double conversion is based on the rule of strtod() of C Standard Library. After the conversion to double, range is checked and construct a object using valueOf() method of each numeric class. If converted value is out-of-range, IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.

        Numeric and Double conversion is performed using BigDecimal.BigDecimal(String) with given String value. MathContext.MathContext(int, RoundingMode) is used for setting presion of BigDecimal based on output column precision. Scale is checked for constructed BigDecimal, and if scale does not match the value defined in output column, it is overwritten with the scale defined in output column. If constructed BigDecimal is out-of-range, IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.

        Binary, VarBinary and LongVarBinary conversion is performed using String.getBytes() with given String value.

        Date conversion is performed using Date.valueOf(String) with given String value. If given String does not match the format of "yyyy-mm-dd", IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        Values from "1582-10-05" to "1582-10-14" are converted by adding 10 days because of the difference between Julian and Gregorian calendar systems. See GregorianCalendar reference for details.

        Time conversion is performed using TimeMicroseconds.valueOf(String) with given String value. If given String does not match the format of "hh:mm:ss[.f...]" (The fractional seconds may be omitted), IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.

        Timestamp conversion is performed by parsing given String value. If given String does not match the format of "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss[.ffffff]" (The fractional seconds may be omitted), IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        Delimiter can be any ascii character, except for the period before fractional seconds value.
        Values from "1582-10-05" to "1582-10-14" are converted by adding 10 days because of the difference between Julian and Gregorian calendar systems. See GregorianCalendar reference for details.

        No conversion is performed for Char, VarChar, LongVarChar, NChar, NVarChar, LongNVarChar and Unknown types.

        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The position of column in this record.
        value - The value as a string to set
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the columnIndex is invalid.
        IllegalArgumentException - If any of the following is true:
        • value is invalid
        • value is out-of-range
        • value is null but output column is non-nullable
